intro: Senecio aschenbornianus, commonly known as the Aschenborn's groundsels, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and gardeners alike.
